result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.

9:36 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defendant Jesus Renteria in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Jesus Renteria. 
Atty Rothstein updates the court as to the status of the matter and requests more time to allow his client to complete counseling in this matter. 
State does not object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.

9:00 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.
Defendant Jesus Renteria in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Jesus Renteria. 
Atty Rothstein requests more time in this matter to allow defendant to complete counsel. 
Offer to amend to citation in this matter. 
State does not object to adjournment.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

08:50 AM Defendant Jesus Renteria in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
